code_quality_scores.note: Scores based on Circle's stablecoin-evm fork only. ChainPort's actual bridge code is not publicly available.

organization.rationale: Well-structured with clear separation of concerns, modular design, comprehensive testing

documentation.rationale: Excellent inline comments, comprehensive external documentation, clear upgrade guides

testing.rationale: 57 test files with unit, integration, and upgrade tests. Coverage tooling in place.

security.rationale: Multi-role access control, pausability, blacklisting. However, centralized upgrade control is a concern.

maintainability.rationale: Clean code, consistent style, automated formatting, type checking, comprehensive CI/CD

overall_quality.rationale: High-quality implementation (Circle's standard), but this is a fork. ChainPort's own bridge code quality cannot be assessed.

strengths: L2Beat integration provides transparency on architecture
weaknesses: Core bridge smart contracts not publicly available
Third-party message relay introduces trust assumptions
No public security audits discoverable in repositories
No open-source development process for bridge infrastructure
recommendations: Open source core bridge smart contracts
Increase congress membership for better decentralization
Verify all smart contracts on block explorers
Add transparency reports on bridge operations
Implement on-chain governance for major decisions

Cannot assess actual bridge implementation code quality
